title: Drawing, "Drawing for a Rocaille Escutcheon", 1740–60
medium: Black and red crayon on paper
signed: Pencil note on the reverse: "Cuvilliès" (genre de cartouches avec encachement rocaille.  Dessin à la sanguine Coll. Destailleur).
provenance: From the Collection of Hippolyte Destailleur
description: Vertical rectangle with the general outline of a harp, a bust of a girl and a shell are in the upper left corner.  An upper field consists of a shell on a stalactite ground.  A lower irregular field looks as if cut out.  Reverse: three concentric circles.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Drawing for a Rocaille Escutcheon", 1740–60.
1740–60. Black and red crayon on paper. Bequest of Erskine Hewitt. 1938-57-937.
